text: Ina Rosenberg Garten (pronounced EYE-nuh; born February 2, 1948) is an American author and host of the Food Network show Barefoot Contessa. She was a staff member of the White House Office of Management and Budget. Garten has a number of best-selling cookbooks, magazine products and a popular Food Network television show. Garten was born in Brooklyn, New York. == Works == === Books === * The Barefoot Contessa Cookbook (1999), Clarkson Potter, * Barefoot Contessa Parties! Ideas and Recipes For Easy Parties That Are Really Fun (2001) * Barefoot Contessa Family Style: Easy Ideas and Recipes That Make Everyone Feel Like Family (2002) * Barefoot in Paris: Easy French Food You Can Make at Home (2004) * Barefoot Contessa at Home: Everyday Recipes You'll Make Over and Over Again (2006) * Barefoot Contessa Back to Basics: Fabulous Flavor from Simple Ingredients Clarkson Potter. 2008. . * Barefoot Contessa: How Easy Is That? Clarkson Potter. 2010. . * * * Cooking for Jeffrey: A Barefoot Contessa Cookbook Clarkson Potter. 2016. * * === Magazine columns === * "Entertaining is Fun!" (Martha Stewart Living 1999–present) * "Entertaining." (O, The Oprah Magazine 2003–present) * "Ask the Barefoot Contessa." (House Beautiful 2006–present) === Television === * From Martha's Kitchen: Ina Garten's Kitchen Clambake (2000) * Barefoot Contessa (2002–present) * Chefography (2006-2010) * 30 Rock (2010-2011) ==References== Category:1948 births Category:American television personalities Category:Writers from Brooklyn Category:Living people
title: Ina Garten
